sys::Thread Class Reference

Documentation

This class creates and manages new threads using POSIX calls.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

sys::Thread::Thread ( int  stack_size = 4096,
bool  detached = true 
)

Constructs a new thread object.

Parameters
stack_sizeThe stack size of the new thread (default is 4096)
detachedWhether to create as a detached thread. If this value is false, another thread must use join() in order for the thread to terminate correctly.

Member Function Documentation

const pthread_attr_t& sys::Thread::attr ( ) const
inline

Allows read only access to the thread attributes.

int sys::Thread::create ( void *(*)(void *)  func,
void *  args = NULL,
int  prio = 0,
enum Sched::policy  policy = Sched::OTHER 
)

Starts the thread.

Parameters
funcThe function to execute as a new thread
argsThe arguments to pass to the new thread
prioThe priority to set for the new thread
policyThe new thread's scheduling policy
Returns
Zero on success

This method creates a new thread. The Thread object only manages one thread at a time. To create multiple threads, you will need multiple instances of the Thread object.

int sys::Thread::get_detachstate ( ) const

Gets the detach state (Thread::JOINABLE or Thread::DETACHED).

int sys::Thread::get_policy ( ) const

Get the thread policy.

int sys::Thread::get_priority ( ) const

Gets the thread priority.

int sys::Thread::get_stacksize ( ) const

Gets the stacksize.

int sys::Thread::id ( ) const
inline

Gets the ID of the thread.

bool sys::Thread::is_joinable ( ) const

This method returns true if the thread is joinable

bool sys::Thread::is_running ( ) const

Checks if the thread is running.

static int sys::Thread::join ( int  ident,
void **  value_ptr = 0 
)
static

Joins the current thread to the specified thread.

Parameters
identthe ID of the target thread
value_ptrA pointer to the return value of the target thread
Returns
Zero on success
int sys::Thread::join ( void **  value_ptr = 0) const

Joins the calling thread with id Thread::id()

Returns
0 if joined, -1 if couldn't join (doesn't exist or is detached)
int sys::Thread::kill ( int  sig)
inline

Sends a signal to the thread.

Parameters
sigThe signal to send
Returns
Zero on success
void sys::Thread::reset ( )

Resets the object (thread must not be running).

After a thread has been created (using create()) and terminated, this method can be used to reset the object so that create() can be called again.

int sys::Thread::set_priority ( int  prio,
enum Sched::policy  policy = Sched::RR 
)

Sets the thread priority.

static int sys::Thread::set_scheduler ( int  id,
enum Sched::policy  value,
int  priority 
)
static

Sets the scheduler.

Parameters
idThe process ID
valueThe policy (such as Sched::FIFO)
priorityThe priority (higher is higher priority)
Returns
Zero on success of -1 with errno set
int sys::Thread::set_stacksize ( int  size)

Sets the stacksize (no effect after create() method).

int sys::Thread::wait ( void **  ret = 0,
int  interval = 1000 
)

Waits for the thread to complete (joins thread if it is not detached).

If the thread is joinable, this method will join the thread which blocks until the thread returns. If the thread is not-joinable, this method will poll is_running() until the thread completes.

static void sys::Thread::yield ( )
static

Yields the processor to another thread
